title: Extract Water from Green Bamboo
brief: Obtain clear, odorless fresh water from green bamboo stalks using a simple cutting technique.
steps: Step 1: Locate green bamboo thickets with fresh, living stalks.
Step 2: Bend a green bamboo stalk down and tie it in the bent position.
Step 3: Cut off the top of the bent stalk cleanly.
Step 4: Position a container under the cut end to catch dripping water.
Step 5: Allow water to drip freely during the night - it will flow continuously.
Step 6: Check old, cracked bamboo stalks as they may also contain water reserves.
warnings: Only use green (living) bamboo - dead bamboo will not produce water.
Purify the water before drinking even though it appears clear.
Water from green bamboo is clear and odorless when fresh.
